title: ESC button changes the screen size
content:
In the current Firefox version (95, Mac OS) pressing the ESC button will resize the screen. This is extremely annoying as this button cannot be used any longer to exit full screen videos, full screen documents, modals and popups on website, as doing so will result in resizing the whole browser window.

This wasn't the case in earlier versions. Extremely annoying, willing to switch browser because of this.
creator: maxagrocka

title: Microsoft Excel online (E1 License) suddenly broke down (became unusable)
content: I was using Firefox to use the Microsoft Office online E1 Licensed ever since I joined my company. It was working without any issues so far but suddenly yesterday in Excel online it showed an error that said we are still loading the workbook and it was not editable. Waiting for hours did not resolve the issue. I should also mention that Firefox is updated to the latest version, sync is on, other workbooks are showing the same error, and I am having no issues with Excel online (same account + same workbooks + new workbooks) in other browsers. Today I tried clearing the cache and online Excel completely broke (screenshot). Please help!
creator: deeproyofficenotes

title: Google won't load
content: Whenever I try to load up google, the page gets caught in an infinite buffer that never loads up the page. It occurs when going to google.com and when just using the address bar to search with google as the default search engine. All other websites seem to load and the internet connection is secure. I have also disabled all my extensions and this issue still occurs. There is no error page either. It just stays "loading" the page.

title: Firefox searching with Bing
content:

So recently I've been trying to google things, and it keeps sending my searches to Bing instead of Google, and much more recently I've been directed to a site called http://24infonews.live/ with a message always saying "Not Found". My only solution to get around this is actually going to google.com. If you could please help me with this it would be much appreciated.

title: Youtube videos randomly darken when in fullscreen
content:
(this is my first time posting here, please bear with me!)

when i'm watching a youtube video in fullscreen, (this only happens in fullscreen, for some reason), the video will randomly darken, but then immediately go back to normal when i do any* button or mouse input, even something as small as moving the mouse slightly. it doesn't even happen every single time i open up the same video, it's completely random.

firefox is fully updated. i've tried restarting my computer multiple times, which makes the problem go away for a while, but then it comes back with a vengeance.

i've also tried resetting the SMC, and that doesn't appear to have done squat, either.

i've tested with a different browser on youtube, issue did not occur. i tested with a different website's video on firefox, issue did not occur. firefox and youtube are just not playing nicely together!Â :+(

thanks in advance for any solutions you guys may have!

  • when i try to take a screenshot, the effect DOESN'T go away, but the screenshot shows the video as normal. to properly communicate what's happening, i've attached an edit a screenshot as close as possible to what i see, and also with what it's supposed to look like.
creator: payton822004

title: Cannot open Firefox after renaming file
content: I renamed the two folders found when putting %APPDATA%\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\ into the File Explorer search bar. Since then I haven't been able to open Firefox normally, as it comes up with an error saying "Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible." I've attempted renaming the folders back to what they once were, but it's still not working.
creator: MJN789

title: "Secure connection failed" on Firefox but not on other browser, starting in last week
content:
Intermittently but more than half the time in the last week, links on Firefox (but not on Edge) to common sites like docs.microsoft.com return > Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to docs.microsoft.com. The OCSP response does not include a status for the certificate being verified. Error code: MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_OCSP_RESPONSE_FOR_CERT_MISSING 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

--- Have cleared cache and rebooted; no change. It looks like the problem is with the browser and not the web site. Running FF 95.0 64-bit on Windows 10
creator: ronks1

title: Button height not working in v95.0?
content:
Hi All,

What is the secret to getting a button height percentage to work in a table td? This code works fine in my Chromium browser but not FireFox v95.0 on Win10 Pro:

<td class="day date"> 

 <button type="button" style="height: 75%; width: 75%;">1</button>

</td>

The width seems to work but not height. Only the table element has a height of 100%. Since this is a calendar app I prefer not to set height for tr and td, if possible.

Is there any way to get this to work otherwise?


Thanks for any help,

Charles
creator: CharlesEF

title: Firefox using large amount of cache, starts running slow and will crash when closing.
content:
Firefox using large amount of cache, starts running slow and will crash when closing. This started a couple months ago and I haven't made any changes other than FF updates and MS updates. To fix this I just run CCleaner and start FF back up, then all runs fine for a day or so. Sometimes I go into Tools, Settings, Privacy & Security, Cookies and Site Data and clear Cache (not cookies). It is normal to see cache at around 511 MB of cache. It starts out fresh at 55.1 MB. I start FF with 8 tabs open. FF is the only application that I start. I didn't use to have this problem, not sure when exactly started. I do have Performance at "Use recommended performance settings". No "hardware acceleration" is checked. Now I do recall some time ago I did not check Use "recommended performance settings" and I checked the number of threads or something like that would be used, I forget exact terminology, but that option seems to have gone away with one of the FF updates

Running FF 94.0.2 (Yes I know 95 is out) Dell Optiplex 8GB Intel Core i5 Windows 10 Pro 21H2 19044.1387

No new addon using Flagfox, Tab Reloader, NoScripts, Undo Close Tab, Webroot Threat Shield and Facebook Container. These have been used for years with no issues.

FF Task manager shows most things low, the highest memory usage Gmail at 27MB.

Right now when using Microsoft Task Manager (I just started FF) I find it using 15 processors for 752MB. Sometimes I have seen up to 40 FF processors. Most are not using any CPU or other resources. Microsoft Task Manager shows 6% CPU, 47% Memory, 2% Disk, 0% Network, 5%GPU. Not at all busy, but running okay now, will take awhile to start the running slow.

Now after all that, is there anything I should be checking or changing? Just went up to 23 FF processors running via viewing MS Task Manager. Still no load on resources.
creator: diverjer

title: Yahoo Mail opens in basic with Firefox and wants me to update.  When I update, Firefox won't open any web pages.  Once I close Firefox, Yahoo Mail looses its update.
